32#ifndef _TTM_BO_DRIVER_H_
33#define _TTM_BO_DRIVER_H_
34
35#include <ttm/ttm_bo_api.h>
36#include <ttm/ttm_memory.h>
37#include <ttm/ttm_module.h>
38#include <ttm/ttm_placement.h>
39#include <drm/drm_agpsupport.h>
40#include <drm/drm_mm.h>
41#include <drm/drm_global.h>
42#include <drm/drm_vma_manager.h>
43#include <linux/workqueue.h>
44#include <linux/fs.h>
45#include <linux/spinlock.h>
46#include <linux/reservation.h>
47#include <asm/page.h>
48
49struct ttm_backend_func {
50 /**
51 * struct ttm_backend_func member bind
52 *
53 * @ttm: Pointer to a struct ttm_tt.
54 * @bo_mem: Pointer to a struct ttm_mem_reg describing the
55 * memory type and location for binding.
56 *
57 * Bind the backend pages into the aperture in the location
58 * indicated by @bo_mem. This function should be able to handle
59 * differences between aperture and system page sizes.
60 */
61 int (*bind) (struct ttm_tt *ttm, struct ttm_mem_reg *bo_mem);
62
63 /**
64 * struct ttm_backend_func member unbind
65 *
66 * @ttm: Pointer to a struct ttm_tt.
67 *
68 * Unbind previously bound backend pages. This function should be
69 * able to handle differences between aperture and system page sizes.
70 */
71 int (*unbind) (struct ttm_tt *ttm);
72
73 /**
74 * struct ttm_backend_func member destroy
75 *
76 * @ttm: Pointer to a struct ttm_tt.
77 *
78 * Destroy the backend. This will be call back from ttm_tt_destroy so
79 * don't call ttm_tt_destroy from the callback or infinite loop.
80 */
81 void (*destroy) (struct ttm_tt *ttm);
82};
83
84#define TTM_PAGE_FLAG_WRITE (1 << 3)
85#define TTM_PAGE_FLAG_SWAPPED (1 << 4)
86#define TTM_PAGE_FLAG_PERSISTENT_SWAP (1 << 5)
87#define TTM_PAGE_FLAG_ZERO_ALLOC (1 << 6)
88#define TTM_PAGE_FLAG_DMA32 (1 << 7)
89#define TTM_PAGE_FLAG_SG (1 << 8)
90
91enum ttm_caching_state {
92 tt_uncached,
93 tt_wc,
94 tt_cached
95};
96
97/**
98 * struct ttm_tt
99 *
100 * @bdev: Pointer to a struct ttm_bo_device.
101 * @func: Pointer to a struct ttm_backend_func that describes
102 * the backend methods.
103 * @dummy_read_page: Page to map where the ttm_tt page array contains a NULL
104 * pointer.
105 * @pages: Array of pages backing the data.
106 * @num_pages: Number of pages in the page array.
107 * @bdev: Pointer to the current struct ttm_bo_device.
108 * @be: Pointer to the ttm backend.
109 * @swap_storage: Pointer to shmem struct file for swap storage.
110 * @caching_state: The current caching state of the pages.
111 * @state: The current binding state of the pages.
112 *
113 * This is a structure holding the pages, caching- and aperture binding
114 * status for a buffer object that isn't backed by fixed (VRAM / AGP)
115 * memory.
116 */
117
118struct ttm_tt {
119 struct ttm_bo_device *bdev;
120 const struct ttm_backend_func *func;
121 struct page *dummy_read_page;
122 struct page **pages;
123 uint32_t page_flags;
124 unsigned long num_pages;
125 struct sg_table *sg; /* for SG objects via dma-buf */
126 struct ttm_bo_global *glob;
127#ifdef __NetBSD__
128 struct uvm_object *swap_storage;
129 struct pglist pglist;
130#else
131 struct file *swap_storage;
132#endif
133 enum ttm_caching_state caching_state;
134 enum {
135 tt_bound,
136 tt_unbound,
137 tt_unpopulated,
138 } state;
139};
140
141/**
142 * struct ttm_dma_tt
143 *
144 * @ttm: Base ttm_tt struct.
145 * @cpu_address: The CPU address of the pages
146 * @dma_address: The DMA (bus) addresses of the pages
147 * @pages_list: used by some page allocation backend
148 *
149 * This is a structure holding the pages, caching- and aperture binding
150 * status for a buffer object that isn't backed by fixed (VRAM / AGP)
151 * memory.
152 */
153struct ttm_dma_tt {
154 struct ttm_tt ttm;
155#ifdef __NetBSD__
156 bus_dma_segment_t *dma_segs;
157 bus_dmamap_t dma_address;
158#else
159 void **cpu_address;
160 dma_addr_t *dma_address;
161#endif
162 struct list_head pages_list;
163};
164
165#define TTM_MEMTYPE_FLAG_FIXED (1 << 0) /* Fixed (on-card) PCI memory */
166#define TTM_MEMTYPE_FLAG_MAPPABLE (1 << 1) /* Memory mappable */
167#define TTM_MEMTYPE_FLAG_CMA (1 << 3) /* Can't map aperture */
168
169struct ttm_mem_type_manager;
170
171struct ttm_mem_type_manager_func {
172 /**
173 * struct ttm_mem_type_manager member init
174 *
175 * @man: Pointer to a memory type manager.
176 * @p_size: Implementation dependent, but typically the size of the
177 * range to be managed in pages.
178 *
179 * Called to initialize a private range manager. The function is
180 * expected to initialize the man::priv member.
181 * Returns 0 on success, negative error code on failure.
182 */
183 int (*init)(struct ttm_mem_type_manager *man, unsigned long p_size);
184
185 /**
186 * struct ttm_mem_type_manager member takedown
187 *
188 * @man: Pointer to a memory type manager.
189 *
190 * Called to undo the setup done in init. All allocated resources
191 * should be freed.
192 */
193 int (*takedown)(struct ttm_mem_type_manager *man);
194
195 /**
196 * struct ttm_mem_type_manager member get_node
197 *
198 * @man: Pointer to a memory type manager.
199 * @bo: Pointer to the buffer object we're allocating space for.
200 * @placement: Placement details.
201 * @flags: Additional placement flags.
202 * @mem: Pointer to a struct ttm_mem_reg to be filled in.
203 *
204 * This function should allocate space in the memory type managed
205 * by @man. Placement details if
206 * applicable are given by @placement. If successful,
207 * @mem::mm_node should be set to a non-null value, and
208 * @mem::start should be set to a value identifying the beginning
209 * of the range allocated, and the function should return zero.
210 * If the memory region accommodate the buffer object, @mem::mm_node
211 * should be set to NULL, and the function should return 0.
212 * If a system error occurred, preventing the request to be fulfilled,
213 * the function should return a negative error code.
214 *
215 * Note that @mem::mm_node will only be dereferenced by
216 * struct ttm_mem_type_manager functions and optionally by the driver,
217 * which has knowledge of the underlying type.
218 *
219 * This function may not be called from within atomic context, so
220 * an implementation can and must use either a mutex or a spinlock to
221 * protect any data structures managing the space.
222 */
223 int (*get_node)(struct ttm_mem_type_manager *man,
224 struct ttm_buffer_object *bo,
225 const struct ttm_place *place,
226 struct ttm_mem_reg *mem);
227
228 /**
229 * struct ttm_mem_type_manager member put_node
230 *
231 * @man: Pointer to a memory type manager.
232 * @mem: Pointer to a struct ttm_mem_reg to be filled in.
233 *
234 * This function frees memory type resources previously allocated
235 * and that are identified by @mem::mm_node and @mem::start. May not
236 * be called from within atomic context.
237 */
238 void (*put_node)(struct ttm_mem_type_manager *man,
239 struct ttm_mem_reg *mem);
240
241 /**
242 * struct ttm_mem_type_manager member debug
243 *
244 * @man: Pointer to a memory type manager.
245 * @prefix: Prefix to be used in printout to identify the caller.
246 *
247 * This function is called to print out the state of the memory
248 * type manager to aid debugging of out-of-memory conditions.
249 * It may not be called from within atomic context.
250 */
251 void (*debug)(struct ttm_mem_type_manager *man, const char *prefix);
252};
253
254/**
255 * struct ttm_mem_type_manager
256 *
257 * @has_type: The memory type has been initialized.
258 * @use_type: The memory type is enabled.
259 * @flags: TTM_MEMTYPE_XX flags identifying the traits of the memory
260 * managed by this memory type.
261 * @gpu_offset: If used, the GPU offset of the first managed page of
262 * fixed memory or the first managed location in an aperture.
263 * @size: Size of the managed region.
264 * @available_caching: A mask of available caching types, TTM_PL_FLAG_XX,
265 * as defined in ttm_placement_common.h
266 * @default_caching: The default caching policy used for a buffer object
267 * placed in this memory type if the user doesn't provide one.
268 * @func: structure pointer implementing the range manager. See above
269 * @priv: Driver private closure for @func.
270 * @io_reserve_mutex: Mutex optionally protecting shared io_reserve structures
271 * @use_io_reserve_lru: Use an lru list to try to unreserve io_mem_regions
272 * reserved by the TTM vm system.
273 * @io_reserve_lru: Optional lru list for unreserving io mem regions.
274 * @io_reserve_fastpath: Only use bdev::driver::io_mem_reserve to obtain
275 * static information. bdev::driver::io_mem_free is never used.
276 * @lru: The lru list for this memory type.
277 *
278 * This structure is used to identify and manage memory types for a device.
279 * It's set up by the ttm_bo_driver::init_mem_type method.
280 */
281
282
283
284struct ttm_mem_type_manager {
285 struct ttm_bo_device *bdev;
286
287 /*
288 * No protection. Constant from start.
289 */
290
291 bool has_type;
292 bool use_type;
293 uint32_t flags;
294 uint64_t gpu_offset; /* GPU address space is independent of CPU word size */
295 uint64_t size;
296 uint32_t available_caching;
297 uint32_t default_caching;
298 const struct ttm_mem_type_manager_func *func;
299 void *priv;
300 struct mutex io_reserve_mutex;
301 bool use_io_reserve_lru;
302 bool io_reserve_fastpath;
303
304 /*
305 * Protected by @io_reserve_mutex:
306 */
307
308 struct list_head io_reserve_lru;
309
310 /*
311 * Protected by the global->lru_lock.
312 */
313
314 struct list_head lru;
315};
316
317/**
318 * struct ttm_bo_driver
319 *
320 * @create_ttm_backend_entry: Callback to create a struct ttm_backend.
321 * @invalidate_caches: Callback to invalidate read caches when a buffer object
322 * has been evicted.
323 * @init_mem_type: Callback to initialize a struct ttm_mem_type_manager
324 * structure.
325 * @evict_flags: Callback to obtain placement flags when a buffer is evicted.
326 * @move: Callback for a driver to hook in accelerated functions to
327 * move a buffer.
328 * If set to NULL, a potentially slow memcpy() move is used.
329 */
330
331struct ttm_bo_driver {
332 /**
333 * ttm_tt_create
334 *
335 * @bdev: pointer to a struct ttm_bo_device:
336 * @size: Size of the data needed backing.
337 * @page_flags: Page flags as identified by TTM_PAGE_FLAG_XX flags.
338 * @dummy_read_page: See struct ttm_bo_device.
339 *
340 * Create a struct ttm_tt to back data with system memory pages.
341 * No pages are actually allocated.
342 * Returns:
343 * NULL: Out of memory.
344 */
345 struct ttm_tt *(*ttm_tt_create)(struct ttm_bo_device *bdev,
346 unsigned long size,
347 uint32_t page_flags,
348 struct page *dummy_read_page);
349
350 /**
351 * ttm_tt_populate
352 *
353 * @ttm: The struct ttm_tt to contain the backing pages.
354 *
355 * Allocate all backing pages
356 * Returns:
357 * -ENOMEM: Out of memory.
358 */
359 int (*ttm_tt_populate)(struct ttm_tt *ttm);
360
361 /**
362 * ttm_tt_unpopulate
363 *
364 * @ttm: The struct ttm_tt to contain the backing pages.
365 *
366 * Free all backing page
367 */
368 void (*ttm_tt_unpopulate)(struct ttm_tt *ttm);
369
370 /**
371 * ttm_tt_swapout
372 *
373 * @ttm: The struct ttm_tt to contain the backing pages.
374 *
375 * Deactivate all backing pages, but don't free them
376 */
377 void (*ttm_tt_swapout)(struct ttm_tt *ttm);
378
379 /**
380 * struct ttm_bo_driver member invalidate_caches
381 *
382 * @bdev: the buffer object device.
383 * @flags: new placement of the rebound buffer object.
384 *
385 * A previosly evicted buffer has been rebound in a
386 * potentially new location. Tell the driver that it might
387 * consider invalidating read (texture) caches on the next command
388 * submission as a consequence.
389 */
390
391 int (*invalidate_caches) (struct ttm_bo_device *bdev, uint32_t flags);
392 int (*init_mem_type) (struct ttm_bo_device *bdev, uint32_t type,
393 struct ttm_mem_type_manager *man);
394 /**
395 * struct ttm_bo_driver member evict_flags:
396 *
397 * @bo: the buffer object to be evicted
398 *
399 * Return the bo flags for a buffer which is not mapped to the hardware.
400 * These will be placed in proposed_flags so that when the move is
401 * finished, they'll end up in bo->mem.flags
402 */
403
404 void(*evict_flags) (struct ttm_buffer_object *bo,
405 struct ttm_placement *placement);
406 /**
407 * struct ttm_bo_driver member move:
408 *
409 * @bo: the buffer to move
410 * @evict: whether this motion is evicting the buffer from
411 * the graphics address space
412 * @interruptible: Use interruptible sleeps if possible when sleeping.
413 * @no_wait: whether this should give up and return -EBUSY
414 * if this move would require sleeping
415 * @new_mem: the new memory region receiving the buffer
416 *
417 * Move a buffer between two memory regions.
418 */
419 int (*move) (struct ttm_buffer_object *bo,
420 bool evict, bool interruptible,
421 bool no_wait_gpu,
422 struct ttm_mem_reg *new_mem);
423
424 /**
425 * struct ttm_bo_driver_member verify_access
426 *
427 * @bo: Pointer to a buffer object.
428 * @filp: Pointer to a struct file trying to access the object.
429 *
430 * Called from the map / write / read methods to verify that the
431 * caller is permitted to access the buffer object.
432 * This member may be set to NULL, which will refuse this kind of
433 * access for all buffer objects.
434 * This function should return 0 if access is granted, -EPERM otherwise.
435 */
436 int (*verify_access) (struct ttm_buffer_object *bo,
437 struct file *filp);
438
439 /* hook to notify driver about a driver move so it
440 * can do tiling things */
441 void (*move_notify)(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo,
442 struct ttm_mem_reg *new_mem);
443 /* notify the driver we are taking a fault on this BO
444 * and have reserved it */
445 int (*fault_reserve_notify)(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo);
446
447 /**
448 * notify the driver that we're about to swap out this bo
449 */
450 void (*swap_notify) (struct ttm_buffer_object *bo);
451
452 /**
453 * Driver callback on when mapping io memory (for bo_move_memcpy
454 * for instance). TTM will take care to call io_mem_free whenever
455 * the mapping is not use anymore. io_mem_reserve & io_mem_free
456 * are balanced.
457 */
458 int (*io_mem_reserve)(struct ttm_bo_device *bdev, struct ttm_mem_reg *mem);
459 void (*io_mem_free)(struct ttm_bo_device *bdev, struct ttm_mem_reg *mem);
460
461#ifdef __NetBSD__
462 const struct uvm_pagerops *ttm_uvm_ops;
463#endif
464};
465
466/**
467 * struct ttm_bo_global_ref - Argument to initialize a struct ttm_bo_global.
468 */
469
470struct ttm_bo_global_ref {
471 struct drm_global_reference ref;
472 struct ttm_mem_global *mem_glob;
473};
474
475/**
476 * struct ttm_bo_global - Buffer object driver global data.
477 *
478 * @mem_glob: Pointer to a struct ttm_mem_global object for accounting.
479 * @dummy_read_page: Pointer to a dummy page used for mapping requests
480 * of unpopulated pages.
481 * @shrink: A shrink callback object used for buffer object swap.
482 * @device_list_mutex: Mutex protecting the device list.
483 * This mutex is held while traversing the device list for pm options.
484 * @lru_lock: Spinlock protecting the bo subsystem lru lists.
485 * @device_list: List of buffer object devices.
486 * @swap_lru: Lru list of buffer objects used for swapping.
487 */
488
489struct ttm_bo_global {
490
491 /**
492 * Constant after init.
493 */
494
495#ifndef __NetBSD__
496 struct kobject kobj;
497#endif
498 struct ttm_mem_global *mem_glob;
499 struct page *dummy_read_page;
500 struct ttm_mem_shrink shrink;
501 struct mutex device_list_mutex;
502 spinlock_t lru_lock;
503
504 /**
505 * Protected by device_list_mutex.
506 */
507 struct list_head device_list;
508
509 /**
510 * Protected by the lru_lock.
511 */
512 struct list_head swap_lru;
513
514 /**
515 * Internal protection.
516 */
517 atomic_t bo_count;
518};
519
520
521#define TTM_NUM_MEM_TYPES 8
522
523#define TTM_BO_PRIV_FLAG_MOVING 0 /* Buffer object is moving and needs
524 idling before CPU mapping */
525#define TTM_BO_PRIV_FLAG_MAX 1
526/**
527 * struct ttm_bo_device - Buffer object driver device-specific data.
528 *
529 * @driver: Pointer to a struct ttm_bo_driver struct setup by the driver.
530 * @man: An array of mem_type_managers.
531 * @vma_manager: Address space manager
532 * lru_lock: Spinlock that protects the buffer+device lru lists and
533 * ddestroy lists.
534 * @val_seq: Current validation sequence.
535 * @dev_mapping: A pointer to the struct address_space representing the
536 * device address space.
537 * @wq: Work queue structure for the delayed delete workqueue.
538 *
539 */
540
541struct ttm_bo_device {
542
543 /*
544 * Constant after bo device init / atomic.
545 */
546 struct list_head device_list;
547 struct ttm_bo_global *glob;
548 struct ttm_bo_driver *driver;
549 struct ttm_mem_type_manager man[TTM_NUM_MEM_TYPES];
550
551 /*
552 * Protected by internal locks.
553 */
554 struct drm_vma_offset_manager vma_manager;
555
556 /*
557 * Protected by the global:lru lock.
558 */
559 struct list_head ddestroy;
560 uint32_t val_seq;
561
562 /*
563 * Protected by load / firstopen / lastclose /unload sync.
564 */
565
566#ifdef __NetBSD__
567 bus_space_tag_t memt;
568 bus_dma_tag_t dmat;
569#else
570 struct address_space *dev_mapping;
571#endif
572
573 /*
574 * Internal protection.
575 */
576
577 struct delayed_work wq;
578
579 bool need_dma32;
580};
581
582/**
583 * ttm_flag_masked
584 *
585 * @old: Pointer to the result and original value.
586 * @new: New value of bits.
587 * @mask: Mask of bits to change.
588 *
589 * Convenience function to change a number of bits identified by a mask.
590 */
591
592static inline uint32_t
593ttm_flag_masked(uint32_t *old, uint32_t new, uint32_t mask)
594{
595 *old ^= (*old ^ new) & mask;
596 return *old;
597}
598
599/**
600 * ttm_tt_init
601 *
602 * @ttm: The struct ttm_tt.
603 * @bdev: pointer to a struct ttm_bo_device:
604 * @size: Size of the data needed backing.
605 * @page_flags: Page flags as identified by TTM_PAGE_FLAG_XX flags.
606 * @dummy_read_page: See struct ttm_bo_device.
607 *
608 * Create a struct ttm_tt to back data with system memory pages.
609 * No pages are actually allocated.
610 * Returns:
611 * NULL: Out of memory.
612 */
613extern int ttm_tt_init(struct ttm_tt *ttm, struct ttm_bo_device *bdev,
614 unsigned long size, uint32_t page_flags,
615 struct page *dummy_read_page);
616extern int ttm_dma_tt_init(struct ttm_dma_tt *ttm_dma, struct ttm_bo_device *bdev,
617 unsigned long size, uint32_t page_flags,
618 struct page *dummy_read_page);
619
620/**
621 * ttm_tt_fini
622 *
623 * @ttm: the ttm_tt structure.
624 *
625 * Free memory of ttm_tt structure
626 */
627extern void ttm_tt_fini(struct ttm_tt *ttm);
628extern void ttm_dma_tt_fini(struct ttm_dma_tt *ttm_dma);
629
630/**
631 * ttm_ttm_bind:
632 *
633 * @ttm: The struct ttm_tt containing backing pages.
634 * @bo_mem: The struct ttm_mem_reg identifying the binding location.
635 *
636 * Bind the pages of @ttm to an aperture location identified by @bo_mem
637 */
638extern int ttm_tt_bind(struct ttm_tt *ttm, struct ttm_mem_reg *bo_mem);
639
640/**
641 * ttm_ttm_destroy:
642 *
643 * @ttm: The struct ttm_tt.
644 *
645 * Unbind, unpopulate and destroy common struct ttm_tt.
646 */
647extern void ttm_tt_destroy(struct ttm_tt *ttm);
648
649/**
650 * ttm_ttm_unbind:
651 *
652 * @ttm: The struct ttm_tt.
653 *
654 * Unbind a struct ttm_tt.
655 */
656extern void ttm_tt_unbind(struct ttm_tt *ttm);
657
658#ifdef __NetBSD__
659/**
660 * ttm_tt_wire
661 *
662 * @ttm The struct ttm_tt.
663 *
664 * Wire the pages of a ttm_tt, allocating pages for it if necessary.
665 */
666extern int ttm_tt_wire(struct ttm_tt *ttm);
667
668/**
669 * ttm_tt_unwire
670 *
671 * @ttm The struct ttm_tt.
672 *
673 * Unwire the pages of a ttm_tt.
674 */
675extern void ttm_tt_unwire(struct ttm_tt *ttm);
676#else
677/**
678 * ttm_tt_swapin:
679 *
680 * @ttm: The struct ttm_tt.
681 *
682 * Swap in a previously swap out ttm_tt.
683 */
684extern int ttm_tt_swapin(struct ttm_tt *ttm);
685#endif
686
687/**
688 * ttm_tt_set_placement_caching:
689 *
690 * @ttm A struct ttm_tt the backing pages of which will change caching policy.
691 * @placement: Flag indicating the desired caching policy.
692 *
693 * This function will change caching policy of any default kernel mappings of
694 * the pages backing @ttm. If changing from cached to uncached or
695 * write-combined,
696 * all CPU caches will first be flushed to make sure the data of the pages
697 * hit RAM. This function may be very costly as it involves global TLB
698 * and cache flushes and potential page splitting / combining.
699 */
700extern int ttm_tt_set_placement_caching(struct ttm_tt *ttm, uint32_t placement);
701extern int ttm_tt_swapout(struct ttm_tt *ttm,
702 struct file *persistent_swap_storage);
703
704/**
705 * ttm_tt_unpopulate - free pages from a ttm
706 *
707 * @ttm: Pointer to the ttm_tt structure
708 *
709 * Calls the driver method to free all pages from a ttm
710 */
711extern void ttm_tt_unpopulate(struct ttm_tt *ttm);
712
713/*
714 * ttm_bo.c
715 */
716
717/**
718 * ttm_mem_reg_is_pci
719 *
720 * @bdev: Pointer to a struct ttm_bo_device.
721 * @mem: A valid struct ttm_mem_reg.
722 *
723 * Returns true if the memory described by @mem is PCI memory,
724 * false otherwise.
725 */
726extern bool ttm_mem_reg_is_pci(struct ttm_bo_device *bdev,
727 struct ttm_mem_reg *mem);

729/**
730 * ttm_bo_mem_space
731 *
732 * @bo: Pointer to a struct ttm_buffer_object. the data of which
733 * we want to allocate space for.
734 * @proposed_placement: Proposed new placement for the buffer object.
735 * @mem: A struct ttm_mem_reg.
736 * @interruptible: Sleep interruptible when sliping.
737 * @no_wait_gpu: Return immediately if the GPU is busy.
738 *
739 * Allocate memory space for the buffer object pointed to by @bo, using
740 * the placement flags in @mem, potentially evicting other idle buffer objects.
741 * This function may sleep while waiting for space to become available.
742 * Returns:
743 * -EBUSY: No space available (only if no_wait == 1).
744 * -ENOMEM: Could not allocate memory for the buffer object, either due to
745 * fragmentation or concurrent allocators.
746 * -ERESTARTSYS: An interruptible sleep was interrupted by a signal.
747 */
748extern int ttm_bo_mem_space(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo,
749 struct ttm_placement *placement,
750 struct ttm_mem_reg *mem,
751 bool interruptible,
752 bool no_wait_gpu);

757 struct ttm_mem_reg *mem);

776 * Returns:
777 * !0: Failure.

813extern void ttm_bo_add_to_lru(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo);
814
815/**
816 * __ttm_bo_reserve:
817 *
818 * @bo: A pointer to a struct ttm_buffer_object.
819 * @interruptible: Sleep interruptible if waiting.
820 * @no_wait: Don't sleep while trying to reserve, rather return -EBUSY.
821 * @use_ticket: If @bo is already reserved, Only sleep waiting for
822 * it to become unreserved if @ticket->stamp is older.
823 *
824 * Will not remove reserved buffers from the lru lists.
825 * Otherwise identical to ttm_bo_reserve.
826 *
827 * Returns:
828 * -EDEADLK: The reservation may cause a deadlock.
829 * Release all buffer reservations, wait for @bo to become unreserved and
830 * try again. (only if use_sequence == 1).
831 * -ERESTARTSYS: A wait for the buffer to become unreserved was interrupted by
832 * a signal. Release all buffer reservations and return to user-space.
833 * -EBUSY: The function needed to sleep, but @no_wait was true
834 * -EALREADY: Bo already reserved using @ticket. This error code will only
835 * be returned if @use_ticket is set to true.
836 */
837static inline int __ttm_bo_reserve(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo,
838 bool interruptible,
839 bool no_wait, bool use_ticket,
840 struct ww_acquire_ctx *ticket)
841{
842 int ret = 0;
843
844 if (no_wait) {
845 bool success;
846 if (WARN_ON(ticket))
847 return -EBUSY;
848
849 success = ww_mutex_trylock(&bo->resv->lock);
850 return success ? 0 : -EBUSY;
851 }
852
853 if (interruptible)
854 ret = ww_mutex_lock_interruptible(&bo->resv->lock, ticket);
855 else
856 ret = ww_mutex_lock(&bo->resv->lock, ticket);
857 if (ret == -EINTR)
858 return -ERESTARTSYS;
859 return ret;
860}
861
862/**
863 * ttm_bo_reserve:
864 *
865 * @bo: A pointer to a struct ttm_buffer_object.
866 * @interruptible: Sleep interruptible if waiting.
867 * @no_wait: Don't sleep while trying to reserve, rather return -EBUSY.
868 * @use_ticket: If @bo is already reserved, Only sleep waiting for
869 * it to become unreserved if @ticket->stamp is older.
870 *
871 * Locks a buffer object for validation. (Or prevents other processes from
872 * locking it for validation) and removes it from lru lists, while taking
873 * a number of measures to prevent deadlocks.
874 *
875 * Deadlocks may occur when two processes try to reserve multiple buffers in
876 * different order, either by will or as a result of a buffer being evicted
877 * to make room for a buffer already reserved. (Buffers are reserved before
878 * they are evicted). The following algorithm prevents such deadlocks from
879 * occurring:
880 * Processes attempting to reserve multiple buffers other than for eviction,
881 * (typically execbuf), should first obtain a unique 32-bit
882 * validation sequence number,
883 * and call this function with @use_ticket == 1 and @ticket->stamp == the unique
884 * sequence number. If upon call of this function, the buffer object is already
885 * reserved, the validation sequence is checked against the validation
886 * sequence of the process currently reserving the buffer,
887 * and if the current validation sequence is greater than that of the process
888 * holding the reservation, the function returns -EAGAIN. Otherwise it sleeps
889 * waiting for the buffer to become unreserved, after which it retries
890 * reserving.
891 * The caller should, when receiving an -EAGAIN error
892 * release all its buffer reservations, wait for @bo to become unreserved, and
893 * then rerun the validation with the same validation sequence. This procedure
894 * will always guarantee that the process with the lowest validation sequence
895 * will eventually succeed, preventing both deadlocks and starvation.
896 *
897 * Returns:
898 * -EDEADLK: The reservation may cause a deadlock.
899 * Release all buffer reservations, wait for @bo to become unreserved and
900 * try again. (only if use_sequence == 1).
901 * -ERESTARTSYS: A wait for the buffer to become unreserved was interrupted by
902 * a signal. Release all buffer reservations and return to user-space.
903 * -EBUSY: The function needed to sleep, but @no_wait was true
904 * -EALREADY: Bo already reserved using @ticket. This error code will only
905 * be returned if @use_ticket is set to true.
906 */
907static inline int ttm_bo_reserve(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo,
908 bool interruptible,
909 bool no_wait, bool use_ticket,
910 struct ww_acquire_ctx *ticket)
911{
912 int ret;
913
914 WARN_ON(!kref_referenced_p(&bo->kref));
915
916 ret = __ttm_bo_reserve(bo, interruptible, no_wait, use_ticket, ticket);
917 if (likely(ret == 0))
918 ttm_bo_del_sub_from_lru(bo);
919
920 return ret;
921}
922
923/**
924 * ttm_bo_reserve_slowpath:
925 * @bo: A pointer to a struct ttm_buffer_object.
926 * @interruptible: Sleep interruptible if waiting.
927 * @sequence: Set (@bo)->sequence to this value after lock
928 *
929 * This is called after ttm_bo_reserve returns -EAGAIN and we backed off
930 * from all our other reservations. Because there are no other reservations
931 * held by us, this function cannot deadlock any more.
932 */
933static inline int ttm_bo_reserve_slowpath(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo,
934 bool interruptible,
935 struct ww_acquire_ctx *ticket)
936{
937 int ret = 0;
938
939 WARN_ON(!kref_referenced_p(&bo->kref));
940
941 if (interruptible)
942 ret = ww_mutex_lock_slow_interruptible(&bo->resv->lock,
943 ticket);
944 else
945 ww_mutex_lock_slow(&bo->resv->lock, ticket);
946
947 if (likely(ret == 0))
948 ttm_bo_del_sub_from_lru(bo);
949 else if (ret == -EINTR)
950 ret = -ERESTARTSYS;
951
952 return ret;
953}
954
955/**
956 * __ttm_bo_unreserve
957 * @bo: A pointer to a struct ttm_buffer_object.
958 *
959 * Unreserve a previous reservation of @bo where the buffer object is
960 * already on lru lists.
961 */
962static inline void __ttm_bo_unreserve(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo)
963{
964 ww_mutex_unlock(&bo->resv->lock);
965}
966
967/**
968 * ttm_bo_unreserve
969 *
970 * @bo: A pointer to a struct ttm_buffer_object.
971 *
972 * Unreserve a previous reservation of @bo.
973 */
974static inline void ttm_bo_unreserve(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo)
975{
976 if (!(bo->mem.placement & TTM_PL_FLAG_NO_EVICT)) {
977 spin_lock(&bo->glob->lru_lock);
978 ttm_bo_add_to_lru(bo);
979 spin_unlock(&bo->glob->lru_lock);
980 }
981 __ttm_bo_unreserve(bo);
982}
983
984/**
985 * ttm_bo_unreserve_ticket
986 * @bo: A pointer to a struct ttm_buffer_object.
987 * @ticket: ww_acquire_ctx used for reserving
988 *
989 * Unreserve a previous reservation of @bo made with @ticket.
990 */
991static inline void ttm_bo_unreserve_ticket(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo,
992 struct ww_acquire_ctx *t)
993{
994 ttm_bo_unreserve(bo);
995}

1001int ttm_mem_io_reserve(struct ttm_bo_device *bdev,
1002 struct ttm_mem_reg *mem);

1005/**
1006 * ttm_bo_move_ttm
1007 *
1008 * @bo: A pointer to a struct ttm_buffer_object.
1009 * @evict: 1: This is an eviction. Don't try to pipeline.
1010 * @no_wait_gpu: Return immediately if the GPU is busy.
1011 * @new_mem: struct ttm_mem_reg indicating where to move.
1012 *
1013 * Optimized move function for a buffer object with both old and
1014 * new placement backed by a TTM. The function will, if successful,
1015 * free any old aperture space, and set (@new_mem)->mm_node to NULL,
1016 * and update the (@bo)->mem placement flags. If unsuccessful, the old
1017 * data remains untouched, and it's up to the caller to free the
1018 * memory space indicated by @new_mem.
1019 * Returns:
1020 * !0: Failure.
1021 */
1022
1023extern int ttm_bo_move_ttm(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo,
1024 bool evict, bool no_wait_gpu,
1025 struct ttm_mem_reg *new_mem);
1026
1027/**
1028 * ttm_bo_move_memcpy
1029 *
1030 * @bo: A pointer to a struct ttm_buffer_object.
1031 * @evict: 1: This is an eviction. Don't try to pipeline.
1032 * @no_wait_gpu: Return immediately if the GPU is busy.
1033 * @new_mem: struct ttm_mem_reg indicating where to move.
1034 *
1035 * Fallback move function for a mappable buffer object in mappable memory.
1036 * The function will, if successful,
1037 * free any old aperture space, and set (@new_mem)->mm_node to NULL,
1038 * and update the (@bo)->mem placement flags. If unsuccessful, the old
1039 * data remains untouched, and it's up to the caller to free the
1040 * memory space indicated by @new_mem.
1041 * Returns:
1042 * !0: Failure.
1043 */
1044
1045extern int ttm_bo_move_memcpy(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo,
1046 bool evict, bool no_wait_gpu,
1047 struct ttm_mem_reg *new_mem);
1048
1049/**
1050 * ttm_bo_free_old_node
1051 *
1052 * @bo: A pointer to a struct ttm_buffer_object.
1053 *
1054 * Utility function to free an old placement after a successful move.
1055 */
1056extern void ttm_bo_free_old_node(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo);
1057
1058/**
1059 * ttm_bo_move_accel_cleanup.
1060 *
1061 * @bo: A pointer to a struct ttm_buffer_object.
1062 * @fence: A fence object that signals when moving is complete.
1063 * @evict: This is an evict move. Don't return until the buffer is idle.
1064 * @no_wait_gpu: Return immediately if the GPU is busy.
1065 * @new_mem: struct ttm_mem_reg indicating where to move.
1066 *
1067 * Accelerated move function to be called when an accelerated move
1068 * has been scheduled. The function will create a new temporary buffer object
1069 * representing the old placement, and put the sync object on both buffer
1070 * objects. After that the newly created buffer object is unref'd to be
1071 * destroyed when the move is complete. This will help pipeline
1072 * buffer moves.
1073 */
1074
1075extern int ttm_bo_move_accel_cleanup(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo,
1076 struct fence *fence,
1077 bool evict, bool no_wait_gpu,
1078 struct ttm_mem_reg *new_mem);
1079/**
1080 * ttm_io_prot
1081 *
1082 * @c_state: Caching state.
1083 * @tmp: Page protection flag for a normal, cached mapping.
1084 *
1085 * Utility function that returns the pgprot_t that should be used for
1086 * setting up a PTE with the caching model indicated by @c_state.
1087 */
1088extern pgprot_t ttm_io_prot(uint32_t caching_flags, pgprot_t tmp);

1096/**
1097 * ttm_agp_tt_create
1098 *
1099 * @bdev: Pointer to a struct ttm_bo_device.
1100 * @bridge: The agp bridge this device is sitting on.
1101 * @size: Size of the data needed backing.
1102 * @page_flags: Page flags as identified by TTM_PAGE_FLAG_XX flags.
1103 * @dummy_read_page: See struct ttm_bo_device.
1104 *
1105 *
1106 * Create a TTM backend that uses the indicated AGP bridge as an aperture
1107 * for TT memory. This function uses the linux agpgart interface to
1108 * bind and unbind memory backing a ttm_tt.
1109 */
1110extern struct ttm_tt *ttm_agp_tt_create(struct ttm_bo_device *bdev,
